questions.question: What is the next number in the series: 2, 5, 10, 17, ?
A person travels 30 km towards the east, then turns north and travels 40 km. How far is he from the starting point?
If 5 workers can finish a job in 10 days, how many days will 10 workers take to finish the same job?
The sum of three consecutive numbers is 48. What is the middle number?
If the area of a square is 64, what is the length of one side?
A car travels 120 km in 2 hours. What is its average speed?
If a book is sold at a 20% discount and the selling price is $240, what was the original price?
What is the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter?
A train moves at a speed of 60 km/h. How much distance will it cover in 30 minutes?
If the ratio of boys to girls in a class is 5:4 and there are 45 boys, how many girls are there?
A person invests $5000 at 5% simple interest per annum. How much interest will he earn in 2 years?
The average of five consecutive numbers is 25. What is the largest of these numbers?
A man can complete a task in 6 days and his son can complete the same task in 12 days. How long will it take for both to finish the task together?
The sum of two numbers is 80, and their difference is 20. What are the numbers?
A person sells a pen for $80 and makes a profit of 20%. What is the cost price of the pen?
If a car covers a distance of 120 km in 3 hours, what is its average speed?
If the perimeter of a rectangle is 36 meters and the length is 10 meters, what is the width?
What is the next number in the series: 3, 9, 27, 81, ?
If 7x + 5 = 40, what is the value of x?
A person travels 20 km towards the north, then turns east and travels 20 km. How far is he from his starting point?
In a class of 60 students, 40% are boys. How many girls are there in the class?
If the cost price of 15 items is $600, what is the cost price of 20 items?
What is the area of a triangle with a base of 10 cm and a height of 5 cm?
The difference between two numbers is 10, and their sum is 60. What is the larger number?
If the price of an item increases by 10% and the new price is $110, what was the original price?
A man walks 4 km towards the north, then turns right and walks 3 km. How far is he from his starting point?
If a product costs $60 after a 25% discount, what was its original price?
A person can complete a task in 5 days. How many days will it take for him to complete 3 tasks?
A shopkeeper sells an item for $150 and makes a profit of 25%. What is the cost price of the item?
The sum of three consecutive numbers is 72. What is the middle number?
What is the average of the first 10 natural numbers?
A sum of money grows at an interest rate of 5% per annum. If the principal amount is $1000, what will be the amount after 3 years?
What is the sum of the interior angles of a hexagon?
The average of five consecutive numbers is 25. What is the smallest number?
A tank can be filled by pipe A in 10 hours and by pipe B in 15 hours. If both pipes are open, how long will it take to fill the tank?
In a group of 60 people, 40% are women. How many men are there?
If a discount of 20% is given on an item worth $200, what is the selling price?
What is the value of 12²?
If a number is divisible by both 4 and 6, what is the smallest number that can be divisible by both?
If a circle has a radius of 7 cm, what is its diameter?
If 4 workers can finish a job in 12 days, how long will 8 workers take to finish the same job?
A person takes 10 seconds to cover 50 meters. What is his speed?
What is the next number in the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, ?
